parameter.name: pairingEnabled
parameter.label: Device Pairing
parameter.description: Pairing must be enabled to connect a new device. Pairing is automatically disabled after the configured pairing time (usually 60 seconds).

parameter.name: pairingTimeout
parameter.label: Pairing timeout
parameter.description: Pairing is automatically disabled after the given time in seconds.

parameter.name: createNewUserOnEveryEndpoint
parameter.label: Pairing: Add unknown user-keys
parameter.description: Set this option to create new users on the fly during the next pairing mode period. This helps with Amazon Echo device discovery. This option is automatically switched off after the timeout.

parameter.name: temporarilyEmulateV1bridge
parameter.label: Pairing: Temporarily emulate V1 Hue bridge
parameter.description: Some Amazon Echos only support V1 bridges (round hardware bridge). This option is only active during discovery and automatically switched off after the timeout.

parameter.name: permanentV1bridge
parameter.label: Permanently emulate V1 Hue bridge
parameter.description: There is no obvious reason to not emulate the newer bridge all the time, but here is the option if you want the old (round Hue bridge) to be emulated.

parameter.name: restrictToTagsSwitches
parameter.label: Switch item tags
parameter.description: The HUE emulation can either publish Switch items if this is set to an empty string or filter items by tags. Use commas to separate multiple entries.

parameter.name: restrictToTagsColorLights
parameter.label: Color item tags
parameter.description: The HUE emulation can either publish all Color items if this is set to an empty string or filter items by tags. Use commas to separate multiple entries.

parameter.name: restrictToTagsWhiteLights
parameter.label: White item tags
parameter.description: The HUE emulation can either publish all Dimmer items if this is set to an empty string or filter items by tags. Use commas to separate multiple entries.

parameter.name: ignoreItemsWithTags
parameter.label: Ignore items by tag
parameter.description: All items that are tagged with the given tags are ignore by the Hue Emulation Service. Use commas to separate multiple entries.

parameter.name: discoveryIp
parameter.label: Optional discovery address
parameter.description: If your host has multiple IP addresses you may specify the IP you would like to advertise in the UPNP discovery process. You may safely leave this empty on most systems.

parameter.name: discoveryHttpPort
parameter.label: Optional discovery web port
parameter.description: Some Hue applications require a different port (80) then what openHAB runs on by default (8080). This option will only advertise a different port then what we are listening on. Useful if you have an iptables rule redirect traffic from this port to the openHAB port.

parameter.name: uuid
parameter.label: Unique Bridge ID
parameter.description: Each Hue bridge has a universal unique id (UUID) assigned. This is random generated if no value has been assigned. Note on Amazon Alexa Echo devices: It might help to change the UUID after you have changed item ids. The Echos will recognize this service as a new bridge.
